Description: A recruitment initiative by the Government of India for the Indian Armed Forces, allowing young individuals to serve as Agniveers on a short-term contractual basis for four years, with the aim of modernizing the forces and providing youth with skills and discipline.
Eligibility Criteria: Age: 17.5 to 21 years; Educational Qualification: Minimum 10th or 12th pass (varies by role); Must meet physical and medical standards set by the Armed Forces.
Required Documents: Educational certificates; Birth certificate; Address proof; Caste certificate (if applicable); Medical fitness certificate.
Application Process: Online registration through official portals of the Armed Forces; Appear for physical and written tests; Undergo medical examination.

Description: Aims to enhance the nutritional status of children by providing hot cooked meals to school children under the Mid-Day Meal scheme.
Eligibility Criteria: Children enrolled in government and government-aided schools.
Application Process: Provided automatically in schools; no separate application required.
URL: Pradhan Mantri Poshan Shakti Nirman (PM POSHAN) in India

Description: A micro-finance scheme providing loans to street vendors to support their businesses post-COVID-19 lockdowns.
Eligibility Criteria: Street vendors with a Certificate of Vending or ID issued by Urban Local Bodies.
Required Documents: Certificate of Vending or ID proof.
Application Process: Apply through banks or online via the PM SVANidhi portal.

Scheme Name: Strengthening Teaching-Learning and Results for States
Description: A World Bank-supported project aimed at improving education quality in Indian states.
Eligibility Criteria: States and Union Territories participating in the program.
Application Process: Implemented through state education departments.

Description: Aims to provide property rights to rural residents by mapping their lands using drones.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural residents without legal property documents.
Required Documents: Proof of residence in rural areas.
Application Process: Facilitated by local panchayats and government bodies.

Description: Aimed at providing employment opportunities to migrant workers returning to their villages during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Eligibility Criteria: Migrant workers in identified districts.
Application Process: Implemented through local government offices.

Description: A scheme to enhance fish production, infrastructure, and income of fish farmers in India.
Eligibility Criteria: Fish farmers, fish workers, and fish vendors.
Application Process: Apply through the Department of Fisheries or state portals.

Description: Provides income support of Rs. 6,000 annually to small and marginal farmers.
Eligibility Criteria: Small and marginal farmers owning cultivable land.
Required Documents: Land ownership records and Aadhaar card.
Application Process: Apply online or through local agriculture offices.

Description: Ensures functional tap water supply to every rural household.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural households in India.
Application Process: Implemented through Gram Panchayats; no direct application required.

Description: Aims to improve groundwater management in water-stressed areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Communities in water-stressed regions.
Application Process: Implemented through local government bodies.

Scheme Name: PM Kisan Urja Suraksha Evam Utthan Mahabhiyan
Description: Promotes renewable energy for agriculture by subsidizing solar-powered pumps and grid-connected systems.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers with cultivable land.
Required Documents: Land ownership proof and Aadhaar card.
Application Process: Apply through state agriculture or renewable energy departments.

Description: A pension scheme for unorganized sector workers, providing Rs. 3,000 monthly post-retirement.
Eligibility Criteria: Unorganized workers aged 18-40 years with monthly income below Rs. 15,000.
Application Process: Enroll through Common Service Centres (CSCs).

Description: Ensures remunerative prices for farmers' produce through MSP and other mechanisms.
Eligibility Criteria: Registered farmers selling produce in mandis.
Application Process: Implemented through state agriculture departments.

Description: Provides health insurance coverage up to Rs. 5 lakh annually for economically disadvantaged families.
Eligibility Criteria: Families listed in the SECC database.
Application Process: Automatically identified through the SECC database; no separate application needed.

Description: An integrated scheme for school education, focusing on pre-school to senior secondary levels.
Eligibility Criteria: Students in government schools.
Application Process: Implemented through schools; no direct application required.

Description: Aims at socio-economic development of minority communities in backward districts.
Eligibility Criteria: Minority communities in identified areas.
Required Documents: Proof of residence and minority status.
Application Process: Implemented through local development offices.

Description: Strengthens governance in rural local bodies by enhancing their capacities and resources.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural local bodies in India.
Application Process: Implemented through state and district administration.

Description: Ensures last-mile electricity connectivity for households in rural and urban areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Households without electricity connections.
Application Process: Apply through local electricity boards.

Description: Focuses on agricultural development and farmer welfare through various sub-schemes.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers and agriculture-related stakeholders.
Required Documents: Land ownership proof and farmer ID.
Application Process: Apply through local agriculture offices.

Description: Provides financial assistance to pregnant women and lactating mothers for their first child.
Eligibility Criteria: Pregnant women and lactating mothers not covered by other maternity benefit schemes.
Required Documents: Pregnancy certificate, Aadhaar card, and bank account details.
Application Process: Apply through Anganwadi centers or health facilities.

Description: Provides financial support to small and marginal farmers with a direct benefit transfer of ₹6,000 annually.
Eligibility Criteria: Small and marginal farmers owning up to 2 hectares of land.
Required Documents: Aadhaar card, land ownership documents, and bank account details.
Application Process: Apply through the PM-Kisan official portal or state agricultural offices.

Description: Aims to expand cultivable land under assured irrigation and improve water-use efficiency.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers in identified areas requiring irrigation development.
Required Documents: Land ownership records and project details.
Application Process: Implemented through state agriculture and irrigation departments.

Scheme Name: MGNREGA (Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act)
Description: Ensures the right to work by providing at least 100 days of wage employment in rural areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Adult members of rural households willing to do unskilled manual work.
Required Documents: Job card, Aadhaar card, and residence proof.
Application Process: Apply through Gram Panchayats or the official portal.

Description: Aims to reduce rural poverty by promoting self-employment and skill development.
Eligibility Criteria: Poor rural households identified through SECC data.
Required Documents: Identity proof, income proof, and residence proof.
Application Process: Implemented through local self-help groups (SHGs).

Description: A flagship program for universalizing elementary education and improving its quality.
Eligibility Criteria: Children aged 6-14 years, especially from marginalized sections.
Application Process: Enrollment facilitated by local schools and education authorities.

Description: Promotes the survival, protection, and education of the girl child.
Eligibility Criteria: All girl children, especially in districts with a low child sex ratio.
Application Process: Awareness campaigns and incentives are implemented through district authorities.

Description: Provides scholarships to meritorious students from economically weaker sections.
Eligibility Criteria: Students in Class 9 from families with an annual income below ₹1.5 lakh.
Application Process: Apply through the National Scholarship Portal.

Description: A unified platform for digital education to ensure inclusive learning.
Eligibility Criteria: Students and teachers in schools and higher education.
Application Process: Accessible through online portals and digital mediums.

Description: Aims to transform India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.
Eligibility Criteria: Citizens and businesses across India.
Required Documents: Depends on the specific initiative under Digital India.
Application Process: Implemented through digital platforms and services.

Description: Encourages innovation and entrepreneurship in schools, universities, and startups.
Eligibility Criteria: Students, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Required Documents: Depends on the specific initiative or grant application.
Application Process: Implemented through various programs like Atal Tinkering Labs.

Description: Provides crop insurance to farmers against natural calamities and pests.
Eligibility Criteria: Farmers cultivating notified crops in notified areas.
Required Documents: Land ownership documents, Aadhaar card, bank details.
Application Process: Apply through authorized banks or Common Service Centers (CSCs).

Description: Provides free LPG connections to women from Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.
Eligibility Criteria: Women from BPL families identified through SECC data.
Required Documents: Aadhaar card, BPL certificate, bank account details.
Application Process: Apply through LPG distributors or online portals.

Scheme Name: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT)
Description: Focuses on urban infrastructure development, particularly water supply and sewerage.
Eligibility Criteria: Urban local bodies (ULBs) in selected cities.
Application Process: Implemented by municipal authorities and state governments.

Description: Aims to provide affordable housing for all by 2022.
Eligibility Criteria: Urban poor, economically weaker sections, and low-income groups.
Required Documents: Aadhaar card, income certificate, and land ownership records.
Application Process: Apply through municipal bodies or the official PMAY website.

Description: Promotes electric and hybrid vehicles to reduce pollution and dependence on fossil fuels.
Eligibility Criteria: Automobile manufacturers and users of electric vehicles.
Required Documents: Depends on the specific initiative under the mission.
Application Process: Implemented through subsidies and incentives.

Description: A flagship skill development program providing training for employment opportunities.
Eligibility Criteria: Indian citizens aged 18-35 years seeking skill development.
Required Documents: Aadhaar card, educational certificates, and residence proof.
Application Process: Apply through PMKVY-affiliated training centers.

Description: Ensures safe and adequate drinking water in rural areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural habitations and villages with inadequate water supply.
Application Process: Implemented through Gram Panchayats and state water departments.

Description: Provides property cards to rural property owners by mapping land parcels using drones.
Eligibility Criteria: Residents of rural areas with disputed or undocumented land ownership.
Application Process: Conducted by local authorities using drone mapping technology.

Description: Provides affordable housing to rural poor.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural poor households listed in SECC 2011 data.
Application Process: Implemented through Gram Panchayats.

Description: Promotes self-employment and skill development in rural areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Poor households identified through SECC data.
Application Process: Implemented through self-help groups (SHGs).

Description: Ensures financial inclusion by providing basic banking facilities to all households.
Eligibility Criteria: Unbanked individuals and households.
Application Process: Open an account at any participating bank or CSC.

Description: Coordinates efforts for skill development across various sectors.
Eligibility Criteria: Youth and working-age population seeking skill development.
Application Process: Implemented through skill development centers and schemes.

Description: Strengthens healthcare delivery systems in rural and urban areas.
Eligibility Criteria: General public, especially marginalized communities.
Required Documents: Depends on the specific program under NHM.
Application Process: Implemented through public healthcare institutions.

Description: Promotes entrepreneurship among women, SC, and ST individuals.
Eligibility Criteria: Women, SC/ST entrepreneurs starting greenfield enterprises.
Required Documents: Business plan, identity proof, caste certificate.
Application Process: Apply through banks or the Stand Up India portal.

Description: Provides skill development training to rural youth for sustainable employment.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural youth aged 15-35 years from poor households.
Application Process: Apply through training centers under DDU-GKY.

Description: Transforms India into a digitally empowered society and knowledge economy.
Eligibility Criteria: General public, businesses, and institutions.
Application Process: Implemented through online platforms and services.

Description: Aims to eliminate open defecation and improve sanitation in rural areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Rural households and villages.
Application Process: Implemented through local Panchayats and government programs.

Description: Promotes self-reliance by boosting local manufacturing and economy.
Eligibility Criteria: Businesses, industries, and general public.
Application Process: Implemented through various government schemes and incentives.

Description: Provides affordable housing in urban areas.
Eligibility Criteria: Urban poor, economically weaker sections, and low-income groups.
Required Documents: Aadhaar card, income certificate, and land ownership records.
Application Process: Apply through municipal bodies or the official PMAY website.

Description: Provides subsidized food grains to eligible households under Targeted Public Distribution System (TPDS).
Eligibility Criteria: Households identified under SECC data or BPL category.
Application Process: Apply through state food and civil supplies departments.
